questions.question: Question 1: Select the wrongly matched pair of excipients and vaccines.
questions.explanation:
Formaldehyde is not used in the BCG vaccine. It is used in IPV and diphtheria and tetanus 
vaccines. Excipients (other vaccine constituents) include: Adjuvants: serve to enhance the immune reaction 
to the vaccine , Stabilizers : stabilize and prolong the shelf-life of the vaccine and Preservatives : preserve the components. Some examples are listed below: • As stabilizing agents- • MgCl2 - OPV • MgSO4 - measles • Lactose-sorbitol and sorbitol-gelatine 168 
Sold by @itachibot • To prevent microbial growth and contamination- • Thiomersal- DPT, hepatitis B, Haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib), rabies, influenza, and 
meningococcal diseases. It contains very small amounts of organic mercury. • Neomycin- MMR and IPV • Other preservatives- • 2-phenoxyethanol - IPV • Phenol - Typhoid vaccine

questions.question: Question 2: Which of the following is false about adjuvants in vaccines?

options.a: Immune response is increased by degree or duration by their use
options.b: They are used in HPV vaccines
options.c: There is a high incidence of side effects with their use
options.d: They help in the reduction of amount of immunogens in vaccines

questions.explanation:
Side effects are rare with the use of adjuvants in vaccines. Adjuvants are substances that are added to vaccines to enhance their immunogenicity by degree 
and/or duration. They help in the reduction of the amount of immunogen in vaccines or in the 
number of doses required to achieve immunity. Aluminium salts are the most commonly used adjuvants. Adjuvants are used in many vaccines like: • Anthrax vaccine • Hep A vaccine • Hep B vaccine • çapanese encephalitis vaccine • DT and DTaP • HPV vaccine • Pneumococcal vaccine

questions.question:
Question 4: A child has come to you for the administration of the IPV vaccine, as part of his routine 
immunisation schedule. Which of the following antibiotics may be found in this vaccine?
questions.explanation:
IPV may contain trace amounts of streptomycin, neomycin or polymyxin B. MMR contain small amount of neomycin. Antibiotics are used during vaccine manufacture to prevent bacterial contamination of tissue 
culture cells.

questions.question: Question 5: Which of the following are the most and least heat-sensitive vaccines respectively?

options.a: Sabin vaccine and hep B vaccine
options.c: çapanese encaphalitis vaccine and pneumococcal vaccine
options.d: Salk vaccine and hep B vaccine

questions.explanation:
Oral polio (Sabin) vaccine is the most heat-sensitive vaccine. Hepatitis B vaccines are the least 
heat-sensitive alongside meningococcal A vaccine, freeze-dried Hib vaccine and pneumococcal 
vaccines.

questions.question: Question 6: Which of the following vaccines should be protected from sub-zero temperatures?
questions.explanation:
Hepatitis B vaccine is sensitive to freezing and should be protected from sub-zero temperatures. Vaccines to be protected from freezing are as follows: • Hepatitis B • Cholera • DTaP-hepB-Hib-IPV (hexavalent) • DTwP-hepB-Hib (pentavalent) • Liquid Hib • IPV • Influenza, pneumococcal vaccines • Tetanus, DT, Td 170 
Sold by @itachibot • Rotavirus (freeze-dried, least sensitive), the liquid form is resistant to freezing • HPV

questions.question:
Question 7: What vaccines are supplied in the type of bottle given below? 163 
Sold by @itachibot
questions.explanation:
The image shows an amber-colored vial. Vaccines like BCG and measles vaccine are sensitive to 
light and thus are supplied in such vials.

questions.question: Question 8: Which of the following is a non-electrical cold-chain equipment?
questions.explanation:
Cold boxes, vaccine carriers, and ice packs are some of the non-electrical components of the 
cold-chain system. Cold boxes are insulated containers used for transportation and temporary storage of vaccines 
and ice packs. Vaccine carriers are usually not used for the storage of vaccines but for their 
transportation. Ice packs generally have two holes in them for placing vaccines. They are filled 
with water. The below image shows a cold box containing vaccines and ice packs.

questions.question:
Question 9: What is the temperature maintained in the freezer compartment of the solar refrigerator 
battery drive?
questions.explanation:
The freezer compartment of the solar refrigerator battery drive is maintained at – 7 °C, and it is 
used to store mainly ice packs. The vaccine storage compartment of this solar cold chain equipment is maintained at 2 to 8 
°C. The other solar cold-chain equipment commonly used is the solar refrigerators direct drive, 
which uses the sun’s energy to freeze phase-change materials like water and then uses this formed 171 
Sold by @itachibot ice bank to keep the refrigerator cold.

questions.question:
Question 10: Which of the following statements is not true about the device shown in the image below? 164 
Sold by @itachibot

options.a: Smaller ones are given to PHCs and the larger ones to district vaccine stores
options.b: They have temperature zones for different vaccines
options.c: Kata thermometer is used to record temperature inside this device
options.d: These devices are provided with baskets to store vaccines

questions.explanation:
The image shown in the question is of an ice-lined refrigerator (ILR). Dial or digital thermometers 
are used to record temperatures inside an ice-lined refrigerator. ILRs are the main method of vaccine storage in primary health centers. They are an important 
part of the cold chain and they maintain a temperature of 2 to 8 °C for the storage of vaccines. They have different temperature zones for different vaccines. The upper zone is for 
freeze-sensitive vaccines like cholera, hep B, rotavirus(liquid), etc while the lower zone is for 
heat-sensitive vaccines like OPV, measles, etc. All vaccines are kept in the basket provided with ILR. Vaccines like OPV, BCG, measles, and çE 
can be kept at the bottom of the basket while, DPT, TT, Hep B, IPV, and pentavalent vaccines and 
diluents are kept in the upper part of the basket.

questions.question:
Question 11: While working as a medical officer in a CHC, you experience a sudden power cut in your area 
due to which the ice-lined refrigerator loses power. What is the time taken for the 
temperature inside this equipment to rise to the maximum recommended temperature limit?
questions.explanation:
Hold-over time is the time taken by cold-chain equipment to raise the temperature inside it, 
during loss of power, to the maximum temperature limit in its recommended range. For an 
ice-lined refrigerator(ILR), this time depends on: • Ambient temperature • Frequency of opening the equipment • šuantity of vaccines kept inside with spacing • Condition of ice-pack lining The below image shows an ILR. 172 
Sold by @itachibot

questions.question: Question 12: At what level is the risk of cold-chain failure the highest?
questions.explanation:
The risk of cold chain failure is highest at the sub-centre and village levels. Thus, vaccines are not 
stored at the sub-centre and are supplied on the day of use.

questions.question: Question 13: Open vial policy is not applicable to which of the following vaccines?
questions.explanation: Open vial policy is not applicable for BCG and measles vaccines. It is applicable for: • DPT • TT • Hepatitis B vaccine • OPV • Pentavalent vaccine • Rotavirus vaccine (New version with the VVM on the side)

questions.question: Question 14: What are the devices given below used to measure?

options.d: Disintegration of vaccine constituents due to temperature

questions.explanation:
The image shown is of vaccine vial monitors (VVM), which measure the cumulative heat exposure 
of the vaccine. VVMs are heat-sensitive indicators that are routinely used to monitor vaccine viability as the 
vaccine vial moves across the supply chain. They record cumulative heat exposure through 
a gradual change in color. If the color of the inner square is the same or is darker than the 
outer circle, the vaccine has been exposed to too much heat and should be discarded.

questions.question:
Question 15: You are preparing to administer the BCG vaccine to a newborn at a PHC. Before 
administering the vaccine, you check the vaccine vial monitor. In which of the following 
observations on the VVM, will you discard the vaccine? 166 
Sold by @itachibot

options.b: Inner square has the same color as the outer circle
options.c: Inner circle has the same color as the outer square
options.d: Inner circle is lighter than the outer square

questions.explanation:
A vaccine must be discarded if the VVM shows the inner square is the same color or darker than 
the outer circle.

questions.question:
Question 16: Which of the following vaccine vials can be used based on the vaccine vial monitor (VVM) 
color changes shown?
questions.explanation:
From the above image, only vials 1 and 2 can be used as the inner squares of the VVMs are lighter 
than the outer circles. 173 
Sold by @itachibot Vial 3 has crossed the discard point as the inner square and outer circle are the same color and 
thus cannot be used. Vial 4 cannot be used as the VVM shows a darker inner square compared to 
the outer circle.

questions.question:
Question 17: You are volunteering in a vaccination camp. You perform a shake test before administering a 
particular vaccine. Which of the following is checked by this test?
questions.explanation:
The shake test is done to check for damage to vaccines that are sensitive to freezing temperatures. Steps to perform the shake test: • A frozen vaccine is used as a control vial and the vial suspected to be damaged by freezing is 
taken as the test vial. • Both are shaken after thawing and the rate of sedimentation is compared. • If the rate of sedimentation in the test vial is slower than that in the control vial, then it is usable 
and has not been damaged. Some of the most widely used vaccines are freeze-sensitive. These include vaccines against: • Diphtheria • Tetanus • Pertussis • Haemophilus influenza type b (Liquid ) • Hepatitis B 174 
Sold by @itachibot Sterilization and Disinfection
